overview: This measure is to appropriate funds for the operating and capital improvement costs of the Judiciary Branch for fiscal biennium 2025-2027. [6] This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Judiciary Appropriations Act of 2025. [5] Your Committee has amended this measure by changing the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [6]
appropriations: As amended, this measure appropriates for Capital Improvements from General Obligation Bonds $11,900,000 (HB400_HD1_.HTM.txt) for FY 2025-2026. [6] For operating expenses, the measure appropriates from General Funds $203,319,009 for FY 2025-2026 and $203,391,600 for FY 2026-2027. [6] The sum total of the general obligation bonds so issued shall not exceed $11,900,000 (HB400_HD1_.HTM.txt). [5]
policy_impact: This measure has been amended by changing the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [6] It has also been amended by clarifying capital improvement projects amounts and cost elements. [6]
revenue_sources: General obligation bonds may be issued, as provided by law, to yield the amount that may be necessary to finance projects authorized in part II and listed in part IV of this Act. [5] The sum total of the general obligation bonds so issued shall not exceed $11,900,000 (HB400_HD1_.HTM.txt). [5] Other funding sources specified in this Act include General funds, Special funds, and Revolving funds. [5]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This measure appropriates funds for the Judiciary for the fiscal biennium beginning 7/1/2025, and ending 6/30/2027. [5] For Capital Improvements in FY 2025-2026, the measure appropriates from General Obligation Bonds $11,900,000 (HB400_HD1_.HTM.txt). [6] These funds are for the Kauai Judiciary Complex Chiller Replacement ($900,000), Lump Sum CIP for Judiciary Facilities, Statewide ($7,000,000), and plans and design for a new South Kohala District Courthouse ($4,000,000). [5] [5] For operating costs from all means of finance, the bill appropriates $216,164,762 for FY 2025-2026 and $216,237,353 for FY 2026-2027. [6] Appropriations made for capital improvement projects shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year for which the appropriations are made. [5] All appropriations made for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. [5]
capital_expenditure_impact: The sums appropriated or authorized in part II of this Act for capital improvement projects shall be expended by the judiciary for the projects listed below. [5] The legislative document specifies $11,900,000 (HB400_HD1_.HTM.txt) from general obligation bond funds for specific projects. [5] These projects include the Kauai Judiciary Complex Chiller Replacement ($900,000), Lump Sum CIP for Judiciary Facilities, Statewide ($7,000,000), and the South Kohala District Courthouse ($4,000,000). [5] [5]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The total appropriation for capital improvements has increased to $11,900,000 (HB400_HD1_.HTM.txt) in general obligation bonds, compared to the previously noted request of $7,000,000 (HB400_HSCR286_.htm.txt). [6] The measure now clarifies capital improvement project amounts, including $900,000 for the Kauai Judiciary Complex Chiller Replacement, $7,000,000 for Lump Sum CIP for Judiciary Facilities, and $4,000,000 for the South Kohala District Courthouse. [5] [5] Additionally, the effective date has been changed to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [6]
